intro: Strychnos cuminodora, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces woody, angular fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry, open woodlands and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
